trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions"></xref> class is used to get or set various LDAP session options.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.AutoReconnect"></xref> property specifies if auto-reconnect is enabled.
This property is `true` if auto-reconnect is enabled or `false` if it is not.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.DomainName"></xref> property returns the domain to which this connection is bound.
The domain to which this connection is bound.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.FastConcurrentBind"></xref> method enables support for fast concurrent binds.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
This method does not work on the current platform.
An LDAP error occurred.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.HostName"></xref> property returns the name of the LDAP server associated with the connection.
The name of the LDAP server associated with the connection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.HostReachable"></xref> property specifies whether the host is reachable.
This property is `true` if the host is reachable or `false` if it is not.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.LocatorFlag"></xref> property specifies one of the values of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags"></xref> enumeration that are used when locating a domain controller.
One of the values of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags"></xref> enumeration that are used when locating a domain controller.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.PingKeepAliveTimeout"></xref> property contains a <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the minimum number of seconds the client waits, after the last response from the server, before sending a keep-alive ping.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the minimum number of seconds the client waits, after the last response from the server, before sending a keep-alive ping.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The specified time span is less than <xref href="System.TimeSpan.Zero"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.PingLimit"></xref> property contains the number of unanswered pings that the client sends before closing a connection.
The number of unanswered pings that the client sends before closing a connection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The specified value is less than zero.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.PingWaitTimeout"></xref> property contains a <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the number of milliseconds that the client waits for the response to come back after sending a ping.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the number of milliseconds that the client waits for the response to come back after sending a ping.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The specified time span is less than <xref href="System.TimeSpan.Zero"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.ProtocolVersion"></xref> property specifies the LDAP protocol version to use.
The LDAP protocol version to use.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.QueryClientCertificate"></xref> property contains a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.QueryClientCertificateCallback"></xref> object that specifies the default callback function used to specify client certificates when establishing an SSL connection.

If the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates%2A> property on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection> object is also set, the certificate specified in the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates%2A> property is ignored.

A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.QueryClientCertificateCallback"></xref> object that specifies the default callback function used to specify client certificates when establishing an SSL connection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.ReferralCallback"></xref> property contains a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ReferralCallback"></xref> object that specifies the default callback function used when chasing referrals.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ReferralCallback"></xref> object that specifies the default callback function used when chasing referrals.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.ReferralChasing"></xref> property contains a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption"></xref> object that specifies how the LDAP library follows referrals returned by LDAP servers.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption"></xref> object that specifies how the LDAP library follows referrals returned by LDAP servers.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The specified value is not defined in <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.ReferralHopLimit"></xref> property specifies the number of hops allowed when chasing referrals.
The number of hops allowed when chasing referrals.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The specified value is less than zero.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.RootDseCache"></xref> property enables the internal RootDSE cache.
This property is `true` if the cache is enabled or `false` if it is not.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.SaslMethod"></xref> property specifies the preferred Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) binding method.
The preferred SASL binding method.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.Sealing"></xref> property enables Kerberos encryption.
This property is `true` if Kerberos encryption is enabled or `false` if it is not.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.SecureSocketLayer"></xref> property enables secure socket layer on connection.
This property is `true` if secure socket layer is enabled or `false` if it is not.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.SecurityContext"></xref> property specifies the security context associated with the current connection.
The security context associated with the current connection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.SendTimeout"></xref> property contains a <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the send time-out.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the send time-out.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The value specified is less than <xref href="System.TimeSpan.Zero"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.Signing"></xref> property enables Kerberos encryption.
This property is `true` if Kerberos encryption is enabled or `false` if it is not.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.SslInformation"></xref> property contains a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SecurityPackageContextConnectionInformation"></xref> object that contains data about the current secure connection.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SecurityPackageContextConnectionInformation"></xref> object that contains data about the current secure connection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.SspiFlag"></xref> property specifies the flags to pass to the Security Support Provider Interface (SSPI) InitializeSecurityContext function.

For more information about the InitializeSecurityContext function, see the InitializeSecurityContext function topic in the MSDN library at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library).
The flags to pass to the SSPI InitializeSecurityContext function.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.StartTransportLayerSecurity(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection)"></xref> method starts transport layer security encryption.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryControlCollection"></xref> object that contains the controls to use.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The request failed.
An LDAP error occurred.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.StopTransportLayerSecurity"></xref> method ends transport layer security encryption.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
The request failed.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.TcpKeepAlive"></xref> property enables TCP keep-alive.
This property is `true` if TCP keep-alive is enabled or `false` if it is not.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.VerifyServerCertificate"></xref> property contains a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyServerCertificateCallback"></xref> object that specifies the default callback method to use to verify server certificates when an SSL connection is established.

A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyServerCertificateCallback"></xref> object that specifies the default callback method to use to verify server certificates when an SSL connection is established.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is already disposed.
